info.headline: Flood Watch issued December 21 at 3:12PM PST until December 23 at 4:00AM PST by NWS Oxnard
info.description: ...FLOOD WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH LATE TONIGHT... * WHAT...A high risk of flooding caused by excessive rainfall. * WHERE...All of Los Angeles, Ventura, Santa Barbara, and San Luis Obispo Counties in Southwest California. * WHEN...Through late tonight. * IMPACTS...There is a high risk of extensive roadway flooding, especially in low-lying areas. There will likely be rock and mudslide activity on and below canyon and mountain roadways. Significant travel delays and road closures are likely. There is a risk of flash flooding and debris flows in and around recent burn scars, especially the South Fire burn scar in Ventura County. Significant creek flooding is expected, with enhanced river flows and a low but present risk of flooding of the Ventura River. Swiftwater rescues are expected. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - Periods of moderate to heavy rain are expected with this storm system. There is also a chance of thunderstorms. Rainfall rates of 0.50 to 1.00 inches per hour are possible, with isolated rates up to 1.50 inch per hour. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: You should monitor later forecasts and be alert for possible Flood Warnings. Those living in areas prone to flooding should be prepared to take action should flooding develop.
